item.title: Emergency Hamburg Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Emergency Hamburg monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Cash, XP and much more.

Emergency Hamburg transforms players into heroes of Hamburg, Germany’s virtual streets in this immersive Roblox experience. As first responders, you’ll tackle emergencies across a sprawling cityscape that developers have expanded by over 60% since launch. Choose your path – join the police force to maintain order, become a firefighter to battle blazes, work as a paramedic saving lives, or experience city life as a civilian. Each role offers unique vehicles, equipment, and responsibilities within the game’s dynamic emergency system.

Progression in Emergency Hamburg centres around earning and spending coins, the game’s primary currency. Players accumulate coins by responding to emergencies, completing missions, and performing their professional duties. This currency lets you purchase new vehicles, equipment upgrades, and specialised tools to enhance your emergency response capabilities. While dedicated gameplay naturally earns rewards, players can use promo codes shared by developers on social media and Discord to claim free coins, exclusive vehicles, and limited-time boosters, significantly reducing the grind required to reach higher ranks and acquire better equipment.

Active Emergency Hamburg Codes

Unfortunately, at the time of writing this article, there are no active codes.

Expired Emergency Hamburg Codes

  • DISCORD150
  • 700M
  • Christmas2024
  • SecondAdvent
  • FirstAdvent
  • Halloween2024
  • RobberyWeek24
  • BusBuddy
  • Update333
  • thehunt2024
  • coach24

How To Redeem Emergency Hamburg Codes

Unlike other Roblox games, redeeming codes in Emergency Hamburg is a bit different as it has been incorporated into the game’s phone system. Here are the steps:

  1. Boot up Emergency Hamburg in Roblox
  2. Press and hold C (or TAB) on your keyboard to access the phone
  3. Click on the Settings option on the left side of the screen
  4. Move to the Redeem Codes tab
  5. Enter the code in the text box that says Enter Codes
  6. Click on the redeem button to get your freebie

How To Get More Emergency Hamburg Codes

Emergency Hamburg codes can be found through several official channels, making it easier for players to boost their emergency response careers with free euros and special items. The most reliable sources include the official Emergency Hamburg Discord server, which you can join to participate in discussions, announcements, and exclusive giveaways where new codes are frequently shared. The developer regularly posts codes across their social media pages including their X and YouTube pages.

However, keeping track of all these sources can become overwhelming, especially since codes have no notification system to alert players when codes expire. Therefore, we recommend bookmarking this guide in your browser, as it is regularly updated with the latest Emergency Hamburg Codes and removes expired ones promptly to ensure you always have access to valid codes.

item.title: Disney Won't Work With Roblox Due to Its Child Safety Concerns, Report States
item.content:encoded:
Put the mouse back in the house.

Concerns over child safety are stopping Disney from collaborating with Roblox, a new report has revealed.

With 151 million daily active users, Roblox is one of the biggest games in the world — if not the biggest. And increasingly, access to this audience is seen as a lucrative and highly accessible method of marketing everything from big-name brands to Hollywood blockbusters.

Still, worries over how safe Roblox is for its enormous audience of players — many of whom are under the age of 18 — remain offputting to Disney, a new Variety report has highlighted.

While some had suspected Disney was avoiding Roblox due to its $1.5 billion investment in rival gaming platform Fortnite, sources told Variety that Disney was instead avoiding Roblox specifically because the company did not believe the larger platform was safe at this time.

Disney content is of course deeply embedded within Fortnite, which regularly hosts Star Wars and Marvel crossovers, recently featured a well-received The Simpsons mini-season, and now includes a small army of licensed skins for everyone from Maleficent to the Mandalorian. A specific Disney Fortnite mode is also in development.

For now at least, Roblox fans shouldn't expect anything similar, the report continues. That's despite Roblox's far larger audience (Fortnite averages between 30 and 40 million daily users) and the platform playing host to other large brands, such as Sonic the Hedgehog and Squid Game.

Roblox The Hatch Event - Screenshots

Following signficant, sustained criticism of its player safety protocols and amid multiple lawsuits, Roblox has added a series of stricter requirements designed to limit who its young audience can interact with. Most recently, the platform added facial age verification to limit communication features in select countries, with a U.S. rollout to follow. But this too has been criticized as something of a band-aid.

"The issue is basically the ability of younger players to cheat those systems — to pretend to be older, to use the older siblings, to use facial identity to get into those systems," Ron Kerb, CEO at child safety platform Kidas, told Variety. "And we know that it's happening on TikTok, we know that it's happening on gaming platforms, on Roblox. Platforms are trying to block kids, and kids are going to find ways to open it up."

In Roblox's most recent Safety Snapshot, the company said it "continued to innovate around safety," and revealed it had open-sourced a version of Roblox PII Classifier, which "has significantly enhanced" its ability to detect and block attempts to violate its policies around sharing personally identifiable information (PII).

Image credit: Katelyn Mulcahy/Getty.

Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social
